result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry P Kimball

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter dated 09/29/2022, filed by Atty Hartley, requesting to adjourn the 10/03/2022 Hearing
Atty Hartley appears on behalf of the Defendant

8:48 AM Defendant Henry P Kimball in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 

Defendant states that he thought he was represented by Counsel from Atty Pecora's office. Court directs the Defendant to contact Atty Pecora's former office re: representation.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Nikole Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Henry P Kimball in court.   

Court informed the defendant that Attorney Pecora is no longer practicing law.
Court informed the defendant to contact Attorney Pecora's office to discuss representation.
  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Henry P Kimball in court.
Attorney Mark A. Pecora not in court. 

Attorney Pecora and request to appear by zoom for today hearing - Court did grant that request.
About 2 pm. the clerk contacted Attorney Pecora's office and spoke with the clerical staff - Staff said they would contact Attorney Pecora and have him log into zoom ASAP.
However, Attorney Pecora never appeared on zoom.
Court provided the defendant a new court date.

  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Pecora requesting to appear by zoom for today's hearing due to illness.

06/13/22 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Attorney Pecora is allowed to appear by zoom for today's court appearance. ep
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

dated 4/29/22, from Defense Counsel requesting adjournment of Hearing
  
**Reviewed by Judge Schimel on 4/29/22. Ok to reschedule.**
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:15 AM Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henry P Kimball in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on March 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Henry P Kimball in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora who appeared by Zoom.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant would like for his attorney to be in person with him before proceeding with a waiver of the preliminary hearing.  The Court will schedule this matter for a waiver of the preliminary hearing to allow for Attorney Pecora to be present in person.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Prelim waived
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:59 AM Defendant Henry P Kimball in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Pecora states this matter may be a waiver but will file a waiver ahead of the next date if it will be.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
